IMDB:
The definitive three-and-a-half hour documentary about the troubled creation and enduring legacy of the science fiction classic "Blade Runner," culled from 80 interviews and hours of never-before-seen outtakes and lost footage. This feature-length documentary is featured on the Two-Disc Special Edition, Four-Disc Collector's Edition, and Five-Disc Ultimate Collector's Edition (DVD, HD DVD & Blu-Ray) of Blade Runner (1982), all released in December 2007.

WIkipedia:
Dangerous Days: Making Blade Runner (2007, 213 minutes) is a documentary directed and produced by Charles de Lauzirika for The Final Cut version of the film. It was culled from over 80 interviews, including Ford, Young, and Scott. The documentary consists of eight chapters, each covering a portion of the film-making Ã» or in the case of the final chapter, the film's controversial legacy.

These are the custom named chapters:
Ch01 Dangerous Days - Making Blade Runner
Ch02 Incept Date 1980 - Screenwriting And Dealmaking
Ch03 Blush Response - Assembling The Cast
Ch04 A Good Start - Designing The Future
Ch05 Eye Of The Storm - Production Begins
Ch06 Living In Fear - Tension On The Set
Ch07 Beyond The Window - Visual Effects
Ch08 In Need Of Magic - Post-Production Problems
Ch09 To Hades And Back - Release And Resurrection
Ch10 Credits
Ch11 END
